page.title: 20Local History
page.content: I live in Bradley's Stores,it was built in 1907 and has a 300ft.bench mark on the brick work and a Victorian post box in the wall.The village changed tremendously in the 1900's.The electric street lights replaced gas in 1924.Horse and cart was used to deliver goods until just before the war.By 1961 the colliery tip was 140ft high and dominated the village.It covered Babell Row and threatened Babell Chapel.In 1964 the colliery closed and in the 1970's the tip was flattened.On the mountainsides are numerous fields separated by dry stone walls in which sheep still graze.On top of Mynydd y Grug is a spoil heap from Bedwas Colliery closed this year after the 1984-5 Miners Strike and which split the community in Cwmfelin. I enjoy living in Cwm,I like its pretty,picturesque surroundings.
